item.title: 1 tiny compiling error that I can't figure out :c
item.dc:creator: @halflive9 halflive9
item.description:
@halflive9 wrote:

Well, you can make it If and don’t add the else or you just add behind the last bracket this:

else { dosomething(); }

item.source: 1 tiny compiling error that I can't figure out :c

item.title: 1 tiny compiling error that I can't figure out :c
item.dc:creator: @Vhenom Vhenom
item.description:
@Vhenom wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:3, topic:414948”]Post the code please, but obviously like the error says, you cannot have an else if statement without firstly having an if statement.

if(condition){ doStuff(); } else if (condition2){ doStuff2(); }

is what it should look like.[/quote]
This is the Code else if (c.dialogueAction == 186) { Server.lottery.enterLottery(c); c.getPA().removeAllWindows(); return; }
How would I make it so the if is on the second line like you guys are saying. I’m a bit confused.

Read full topic
item.source: 1 tiny compiling error that I can't figure out :c

item.title: 1 tiny compiling error that I can't figure out :c
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Post the code please, but obviously like the error says, you cannot have an else if statement without firstly having an if statement.

if(condition){ doStuff(); } else if (condition2){ doStuff2(); }

is what it should look like.

Read full topic
